ObjectHierarchyRelationship.name: ObjectHierarchyRelationship
ObjectHierarchyRelationship.description: Represents the mapping between an input source object and an output target object. For example, mapping details to transform a sales quote into a sales agreement. This object is available in API version 56.0 and later.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object hierarchy relationship record.

FullName.description: The full name of the associated object hierarchy relationship record in Metadata API.

InputObjRecordsGrpFieldName.description: The field name of the input object that groups records.

MappingType.description: Specifies the type of relationship between the source and target object.

OutputPntRelationshipFieldName.description: Specifies the relationship between a child and parent for an output object.

ParentRecordId.description: The ID of the parent object mapping record.

ParentRelationshipFieldName.description: The name of the field that defines the relationship between a parent and child.

SourceReferenceRelaFieldName.description: The field name that defines the relationship between the input and output object.
